citation.article-title: Altererythrobacter marinus sp. nov., isolated from deep seawater
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Altererythrobacter marinus sp. nov.
Altererythrobacter marinus (ma.ri′nus. L. masc. adj. marinus of the sea, marine).
Cells are rod-shaped (1.0–1.2 μm long and 0.4 μm wide) and non-motile.
On 216L agar, forms smooth yellow colonies with regular edges that are 1–2 mm in diameter after 72 h incubation at 28 °C and slightly raised in the centre.

Positive for catalase, lipase (Tween 80) and hydrolysis of aesculin, but negative for Gram reaction, oxidase, amylase, urease, gelatinase, arginine dihydrolase, indole production, H2S production, glucose fermentation and reduction of nitrate to nitrite.
Growth, assessed over 7 days, is observed in 0.5–5.0 % NaCl (optimum 3 %) and at 10–42 °C (optimum 25–37 °C), but not at 4 or 45 °C.
The major respiratory quinone is ubiquinone 10.
Principal fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, 11-methyl C18 : 1ω7c and C16 : 0.

Sensitive to ampicillin (10 μg per disc), carbenicillin (100 μg), cefalexin (30 μg), cefazolin (30 μg), cefobid (30 μg), cephradine (30 μg), chloromycetin (30 μg), ciprofloxacin (5 μg), co-trimoxazole (25 μg), erythromycin (15 μg), kanamycin (30 μg), penicillin G (10 μg), piperacillin (100 μg), rifampicin (5 μg), rocephin (30 μg), tetracycline (30 μg), vancomycin (30 μg) and vibramycin (30 μg).

Resistant to clindamycin (2 μg), furazolidone (15 μg), gentamicin (10 μg), lincomycin (2 μg), metronidazole (5 μg), minomycin (30 μg), neomycin (10 μg), norfloxacin (10 μg), ofloxacin (5 μg), oxacillin (1 μg), polymyxin B (30 U) or streptomycin (10 μg).

In API ZYM tests, positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase lipase (C8), leucine aminopeptidase, trypsin, valine aminopeptidase and α-chymotrypsin; weakly positive for acid phosphatase, cystine aminopeptidase, esterase (C4), lipase (C14), naphthol-AS-BI-phosphoamidase, α-glucosidase and β-glucosidase; and negative for N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, α-mannosidase, β-galactosidase and β-glucuronidase.
Of the 12 carbon substrates in the API 20NE strip, can only utilize maltose.

Of the 95 carbon substrates in the Biolog system, positive for acetic acid, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, l-ornithine, l-phenylalanine, l-threonine, α-cyclodextrin, Tweens 40 and 80, maltose, methylpyruvate, monomethyl succinate, β-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, l-glutamic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, l-leucine, l-proline and l-serine.
The type strain is H32T (=CCTCC AB 208229T =LMG 24629T =MCCC 1A01070T), isolated from deep seawater of the Indian Ocean.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 66.5 mol%.
